_meta.description: Broadway show metadata - source of truth for all shows

shows.title: Two Strangers (Carry a Cake Across New York)
shows.synopsis: A new musical comedy about two strangers who meet on the streets of New York City when Robin agrees to help Dougal carry a cake across town. As they navigate the city together, unexpected connection and romance bloom in this charming, laugh-filled love story celebrating chance encounters and the magic of New York.

shows.title: Maybe Happy Ending
shows.synopsis: In a future where robots have become obsolete, two helper-bots discover what it means to be human through an unexpected connection. Winner of six 2025 Tony Awards including Best Musical.

shows.title: The Outsiders
shows.synopsis: Based on S.E. Hinton's classic novel, this electrifying new musical follows the Greasers and Socs in 1967 Tulsa as they navigate loyalty, love, and the struggle to belong. Winner of the 2024 Tony Award for Best Musical.

shows.title: Hell's Kitchen
shows.synopsis: A new musical featuring the songs of 16-time Grammy Award winner Alicia Keys. Set in 1990s New York, a 17-year-old girl dreams of a life beyond her Hell's Kitchen block.

shows.title: Operation Mincemeat
shows.synopsis: The Olivier Award-winning Best New Musical tells the outrageous true story of the WWII plot to fool Hitler with a corpse, fake documents, and an idealistic intelligence team.

shows.title: Oh, Mary!
shows.synopsis: Cole Escola's uproarious comedy imagines Mary Todd Lincoln as a miserable, hard-drinking woman who dreams of becoming a cabaret star while her husband prepares for that fateful night at Ford's Theatre.

shows.title: The Great Gatsby
shows.synopsis: F. Scott Fitzgerald's iconic novel roars to life in this dazzling new musical. Jay Gatsby throws lavish parties in pursuit of his lost love, Daisy Buchanan, in the glittering Jazz Age.

shows.title: Bug
shows.synopsis: Tracy Letts' psychological thriller makes its Broadway premiere. In a seedy Oklahoma motel, an unexpected romance between a lonely waitress and mysterious drifter twists into paranoia and delusion.

shows.title: Wicked
shows.synopsis: The untold story of the Witches of Oz. Long before Dorothy arrives, Elphaba and Glinda meet as sorcery students and form an unlikely friendship that will change the land of Oz forever.

shows.title: Hamilton
shows.synopsis: The story of America's Founding Father Alexander Hamilton, an immigrant from the West Indies who became George Washington's right-hand man and the nation's first Treasury Secretary.

shows.title: The Lion King
shows.synopsis: Disney's award-winning musical brings the African savanna to Broadway with stunning puppetry and masks. Young Simba must embrace his destiny to become king after tragedy strikes the Pride Lands.

shows.title: Chicago
shows.synopsis: Set in the legendary city during the roaring twenties, Chicago tells the story of Roxie Hart, a housewife who murders her lover and convinces her husband to take the fall. The longest-running American musical in Broadway history.

shows.title: Moulin Rouge! The Musical
shows.synopsis: Enter a world of splendor and romance, of eye-popping excess, of glitz, grandeur and glory! A world where Bohemians and aristocrats rub elbows and revel in electrifying enchantment.

shows.title: Aladdin
shows.synopsis: Disney's thrilling adaptation of the animated classic. From the producer of The Lion King comes the story of a street-smart young man who discovers a magic lamp and genie.

creativeTeam.name: Howard Ashman, Tim Rice & Chad Beguelin

shows.title: Hadestown
shows.synopsis: Welcome to Hadestown, where a song can change your fate. This acclaimed new musical by Anaïs Mitchell intertwines two mythic tales — that of Orpheus and Eurydice, and King Hades and his wife Persephone.

shows.title: MJ The Musical
shows.synopsis: The story of Michael Jackson, centering around the making of his 1992 Dangerous World Tour, revealing the creative mind and collaborative spirit that catapulted him into legendary status.

shows.title: SIX
shows.synopsis: The six wives of Henry VIII take the mic to tell their own stories and reclaim their identities in this electrifying pop concert musical.

shows.title: The Book of Mormon
shows.synopsis: From the creators of South Park comes this hilarious musical about two mismatched Mormon missionaries sent to spread the word in a remote Ugandan village.

creativeTeam.name: Trey Parker, Robert Lopez & Matt Stone

shows.title: & Juliet
shows.synopsis: What if Juliet's story didn't end in tragedy? This joyful jukebox musical featuring Max Martin's iconic pop hits reimagines Shakespeare's heroine as she writes her own destiny.

shows.title: Oedipus
shows.synopsis: A new adaptation of Sophocles' masterpiece starring Rami Malek and Indira Varma. When a plague devastates Thebes, King Oedipus discovers the shocking truth about his origins.

shows.title: Harry Potter and the Cursed Child
shows.synopsis: Nineteen years after Harry's original adventure, he's now a Ministry of Magic employee while his son Albus struggles with the family legacy at Hogwarts.

shows.title: Mamma Mia!
shows.synopsis: ABBA's hits tell the story of a young woman's search for her birth father on a Greek island paradise. A sunny, funny tale of love, laughter and friendship.

shows.title: Stranger Things: The First Shadow
shows.synopsis: Hawkins, 1959: A regular American town where nothing strange happens. Until a young student arrives, fleeing the horrors of childhood, and everything changes. The prequel to the hit Netflix series.

shows.title: Cabaret at the Kit Kat Club
shows.synopsis: Willkommen to the Kit Kat Club! This immersive, Tony-winning revival transforms the theater into a 1930s Berlin nightclub. Starring Eddie Redmayne as the Emcee.

shows.title: Stereophonic
shows.synopsis: Set in a 1970s recording studio, this Pulitzer Prize-winning play follows a rock band creating their masterpiece as personal tensions threaten to tear them apart.

shows.title: Water for Elephants
shows.synopsis: Based on the bestselling novel, this Depression-era love story unfolds at a traveling circus where a young veterinarian falls for the star performer.

shows.title: Suffs
shows.synopsis: The story of the American women's suffrage movement, following Alice Paul and her fellow suffragettes as they fight for the 19th Amendment.

shows.title: The Notebook
shows.synopsis: Based on Nicholas Sparks' beloved novel, this musical tells the epic love story of Noah and Allie across decades, featuring three couples at different stages of their relationship.

shows.title: Marjorie Prime
shows.synopsis: In the near future, a woman in her eighties named Marjorie spends time with a holographic projection of her late husband. As her memory fades, her family grapples with what it means to remember and be remembered.

shows.title: Liberation
shows.synopsis: A powerful drama exploring themes of freedom and identity.

shows.title: Boop! The Musical
shows.synopsis: Betty Boop makes her Broadway debut in this new musical celebrating the iconic cartoon character.

shows.title: The Queen of Versailles
shows.synopsis: Based on the documentary film, this musical tells the story of Jackie Siegel and her family's quest to build the largest house in America.

shows.title: Death Becomes Her
shows.synopsis: Based on the cult classic film, two rivals discover a magical potion that promises eternal youth, with hilarious and deadly consequences.

shows.title: Buena Vista Social Club
shows.synopsis: A musical celebration of the legendary Cuban musicians who came together to record the Grammy-winning album.

shows.title: Ragtime
shows.synopsis: The sweeping musical about three families in turn-of-the-century America returns to Broadway.

shows.title: Chess
shows.synopsis: The Cold War chess musical with music by ABBA's Benny Andersson and Björn Ulvaeus finally arrives on Broadway.

shows.title: Just in Time
shows.synopsis: A new musical celebrating the life and music of Dean Martin.

shows.title: The Roommate
shows.synopsis: A play by Jen Silverman starring Patti LuPone and Mia Farrow as unlikely roommates.

shows.title: Our Town
shows.synopsis: Thornton Wilders beloved American classic starring Jim Parsons and Katie Holmes.

shows.title: Back to the Future: The Musical
shows.synopsis: Based on the iconic 1985 film, Marty McFly travels back in time in the DeLorean.

shows.title: Every Brilliant Thing
shows.synopsis: See Tony Award winner Daniel Radcliffe back on Broadway. Radcliffe dazzled audiences and won a Tony for the acclaimed revival of

shows.title: Beaches, A New Musical
shows.synopsis: Beaches, A New Musical, based on the best-selling novel that became the blockbuster film, brings to the stage one of the most iconic friendships in popular culture. This sweeping, emotional, and joy-filled new musical follows the vivacious Cee Cee and elegant Bertie, who meet as children and become fast friends. From pen-pals to roommates to romantic rivals, Cee Cee and Bertie’s oil-and-water friendship perseveres over the course of 30 years through even the most tragic trials. With a touching v

shows.synopsis: Elevator access, wheelchair access, assisted listening devices, on-demand closed captioning, open captioning, audio description, Braille and large print Playbills

shows.title: Becky Shaw
shows.synopsis: Wheelchair seating in Orchestra and Mezzanine. ADA Stage Door entrance. Elevator access. T-coil listening, open captioning, and audio description.

creativeTeam.name: Milo Rau recreates the Rwandan RTLM radio station and its chilling hate

shows.title: CATS: The Jellicle Ball
shows.synopsis: COME ONE, COME ALL – The Jellicle Cats are having a BALL. Based on T.S. Eliot’s Old Possum’s Book of Practical Cats, Andrew Lloyd Webber's worldwide phenomenon CATS is reimagined in a production that smashed records, won awards and left New York City purring. And now CATS: The Jellicle Ball ascends to Broadway in a kaleidoscope of glittering spectacle, iconic music and electrifying ballroom choreography that The New York Times calls “a lightning strike that sets joy free!”Broadway meets Runway i

shows.title: Dog Day Afternoon
shows.synopsis: The legendary true crime story that captivated audiences in the acclaimed film is now a live, pulse-pounding Broadway event.

shows.synopsis: See this delightful and delirious classic comedy starring Emmy Award nominee Rose Byrne and Tony Award winner and Emmy nominee Kelli O’Hara. A classic Noël Coward farce, directed by Scott Ellis,

shows.title: The Fear of 13
shows.synopsis: The Fear of 13 tells the extraordinary true story of Nick Yarris, who spends more than  two decades on death row for a murder he insists he did not commit. Through a series  of prison visits with a volunteer named Jackie, Nick traces a life shaped by impulse and  consequence. As Nick and Jackie’s conversations deepen, the line between witness  and participant blurs, forcing both to confront what justice demands, what belief  requires, and the perilous distance between true freedom and the illusi

shows.synopsis: Wheelchair and transfer seating available; accessible restrooms; assistive listening and visual aids available; upper levels may be inaccessible.

shows.title: Joe Turner's Come and Gone
shows.synopsis: See Taraji P. Henson and Cedric “The Entertainer" star in August Wilson's classic play about the powerful quest for identity, belonging, and healing.

shows.title: The Lost Boys
shows.synopsis: Wheelchair seating available on all levels (Orchestra, Rear Mezzanine, and Balcony), accessible via passenger elevator.

shows.title: Proof
shows.synopsis: "Proof" is a captivating musical that delves into the complex relationship between a brilliant but troubled mathematician and his equally gifted daughter. As she grapples with the burden of her father's genius and mental illness, the young woman must confront her own doubts and fears to uncover a groundbreaking mathematical proof hidden within her father's notebooks. Blending heart-wrenching drama with moments of poignant humor, "Proof" explores the universal themes of family, legacy, and the pursuit of truth.

shows.title: The Rocky Horror Show
shows.synopsis: Filled with fun, frolics and frocks, this is the show the Daily Telegraph calls “fresh, subversive, and essential.”

creativeTeam.name: Milo Rau recreates the Rwandan RTLM radio station and its chilling hate
Winnie Holzman based on the novel by Gregory Maguire

shows.title: Titanique
shows.synopsis: Watch Dion (Mindelle) crash a tour group at a Titanic museum to tell them what really happened to Jack and Rose — and it's not how Hollywood tells it. The whole thing is set to Dion's hits (including, of course, "My Heart Will Go On") and a nonstop wave of movie spoofs and up-to-the-minute pop culture jokes.

creativeTeam.name: Milo Rau recreates the Rwandan RTLM radio station and its chilling hate
Winnie Holzman based on the novel by Gregory Maguire
Franklin Shepard and his two lifelong friends
George Gershwin and his brother lyricist Ira Gershwin

shows.title: All Out: Comedy About Ambition
shows.synopsis: From the writer of last year's runaway hit, All In: Comedy About Love, comes All Out: Comedy About Ambition. Here's how it works: a group of the funniest people on earth gather on Broadway (four at a time) to read hilarious stories by Simon Rich about ego, envy, greed, and basically just New Yorkers in general.

shows.title: Real Women Have Curves
shows.synopsis: Based on the beloved play and film, this new musical follows Ana, a first-generation Mexican-American teenager in East LA, torn between her dreams of going to college and her family's expectations. With an original Latin pop-infused score, it's a joyful celebration of family, identity, and self-acceptance.

shows.title: Redwood
shows.synopsis: After her son's death, Jesse leaves her wife and work, drives across the US to the redwood forest, and forms a profound relationship with a giant redwood tree. Inspired by the life of Julia Butterfly Hill, this new musical explores grief, connection, and the healing power of nature.

shows.title: Days of Wine and Roses
shows.synopsis: A new musical adaptation of the classic 1962 film about two people who fall in love and descend into alcoholism together. With music by Adam Guettel and book by Craig Lucas.

shows.title: Harmony
shows.synopsis: The story of the Comedian Harmonists, a singing group in 1920s and 30s Germany who became international stars before being silenced by the Nazi regime.

shows.title: Here Lies Love
shows.synopsis: An immersive dance-floor musical experience about the rise and fall of Imelda Marcos, First Lady of the Philippines. Features music by David Byrne and Fatboy Slim.

shows.title: How to Dance in Ohio
shows.synopsis: Based on the documentary, this groundbreaking musical follows seven autistic young adults preparing for their first spring formal dance. Historic for featuring autistic actors in all seven lead roles.

shows.title: Illinoise
shows.synopsis: A dance musical set to Sufjan Stevens' iconic album 'Illinois', telling stories of love, loss, and hope through breathtaking choreography.

shows.title: Lempicka
shows.synopsis: The story of bold Art Deco painter Tamara de Lempicka, exploring her artistic ambition, passionate love affairs, and escape from war-torn Europe.

shows.title: Once Upon a One More Time
shows.synopsis: A jukebox musical featuring the songs of Britney Spears, where fairy tale princesses discover feminism and rewrite their own stories.

shows.title: The Heart of Rock and Roll
shows.synopsis: A jukebox musical featuring the songs of Huey Lewis and the News, following Bobby who must choose between his rock star dreams and a stable job.

shows.title: Gutenberg! The Musical!
shows.synopsis: A two-man comedy musical about aspiring playwrights who present their ridiculous musical about Johannes Gutenberg using hats to play all the characters.

shows.title: Merrily We Roll Along
shows.synopsis: Sondheim's musical told in reverse, following three friends—a composer, a playwright, and a writer—from middle-age success back to their hopeful youth. Tony-winning 2023 revival.

shows.title: Spamalot
shows.synopsis: The Tony Award-winning musical comedy lovingly ripped off from Monty Python and the Holy Grail, following King Arthur and his knights on their quest for the Holy Grail.

shows.title: The Who's Tommy
shows.synopsis: A deaf, dumb, and blind boy becomes a pinball champion in this rock opera. The acclaimed revival directed by Des McAnuff featuring The Who's iconic score.

shows.title: The Wiz
shows.synopsis: The Tony-winning African American retelling of The Wizard of Oz with a soulful R&B score. Starring Wayne Brady and Deborah Cox.

shows.title: Grey House
shows.synopsis: A horror play about a couple who crashes their car in the mountains and seeks shelter in a cabin, only to discover terrifying secrets within.

shows.title: I Need That
shows.synopsis: A darkly comic new play about a man buried alive in his stuff and the estranged family members trying to help him.

shows.title: Jaja's African Hair Braiding
shows.synopsis: A vibrant comedy set in a Harlem hair braiding salon on the hottest day of summer, where the lives of West African immigrant women intertwine.

shows.title: Just for Us
shows.synopsis: Alex Edelman's solo show about accidentally attending a secret gathering of white supremacists, blending comedy with sharp social commentary.

shows.title: Mary Jane
shows.synopsis: A profound drama about a single mother caring for her medically fragile son, finding community among the nurses, therapists, and caregivers who help her.

shows.title: Mother Play
shows.synopsis: Paula Vogel's autobiographical memory play exploring her complicated relationship with her mother through decades of family history.

shows.title: Patriots
shows.synopsis: A political thriller about Boris Berezovsky's role in Vladimir Putin's rise to power, and the oligarch's subsequent fall from grace.

shows.title: Prayer for the French Republic
shows.synopsis: An epic family drama spanning generations, exploring the lives of a Jewish family in France grappling with rising antisemitism and questions of identity.

shows.title: The Cottage
shows.synopsis: A farce set in 1920s England where a wife's infidelity is discovered, leading to a cascade of comic revelations and twists.

shows.title: The Shark Is Broken
shows.synopsis: A behind-the-scenes comedy about the chaotic filming of Jaws, as three actors stuck on a boat deal with mechanical failures and clashing egos.

shows.title: An Enemy of the People
shows.synopsis: Ibsen's classic play about a doctor who discovers the town's water supply is contaminated and faces fierce opposition when trying to expose the truth.

shows.title: Appropriate
shows.synopsis: Three estranged siblings reunite to settle their late father's estate in Arkansas, where a disturbing discovery forces them to confront dark family secrets.

shows.title: Doubt: A Parable
shows.synopsis: A nun becomes suspicious of a priest's relationship with a young student at a Bronx Catholic school in this Pulitzer Prize-winning drama.

shows.title: Purlie Victorious: A Non-Confederate Romp Through the Cotton Patch
shows.synopsis: A satirical comedy about a self-appointed preacher returning to the Georgia town of his youth to claim the inheritance of his aunt, integrating the church and reclaiming land.

shows.title: Uncle Vanya
shows.synopsis: Chekhov's masterpiece about a family gathering at a rural estate where simmering resentments and unrequited loves come to the surface.
